problem_text: 12.69. Let F be a countably infinite field and G a finite group of automorphisms of F. The group ring ZG acts on F in a natural way. Suppose that S is a subfield of F satisfying the following property: for any x ∈ F there is a non-zero element f ∈ ZG such that xf ∈ S. Is it true that either F = S or the field extension F/S is purely inseparable? One can show that for an uncountable field an analogous question has an affirmative answer. K. N. Ponomar¨ev
